Description: Determines the size of a cache block, which must cover a contiguous, naturally aligned power-of-two (NAPOT) range of memory and is discoverable via the execution environment.
Constraints: ['Cache blocks must represent naturally aligned power-of-two or NAPOT memory ranges.', 'In the initial set of CMO extensions, the cache block size shall be uniform throughout the system.']
Keywords: implementation-specific, shall be uniform, uniform, shall be uniform, implementation-specific, naturally aligned, cache blocks, contiguous, size, cache block, NAPOT, implementation-specific, uniform, power-of-two, shall

Description: The total capacity of the cache, which can vary between implementations.
Constraints: Must be a power‑of‑two aligned size; the exact value is defined by the implementation.
Keywords: implementation-specific, implementation-specific, discover information, organization, cache, capacity

Description: The structural arrangement and mapping policies of a cache (e.g., associativity, replacement policy)
Constraints: No explicit constraints; the organization is defined by the implementation.
Keywords: implementation-specific, implementation-specific, discover information, organization

Description: The means by which software discovers cache and cache block information provided by the execution environment.
Constraints: The execution environment "provides software a means to discover" — implying such a mechanism must exist but its form is not specified.
Keywords: provides software a means to discover

Description: Controls the total capacity and internal organization parameters (e.g., associativity, number of sets) of each cache level.
Keywords: implementation-specific

Description: The method provided by the execution environment for software to discover cache and cache block details.
Constraints: Must provide a means for software to discover information.
Keywords: provides software a means to discover

Description: Whether the size of a cache block is uniform throughout the system
Constraints: Shall be uniform in the initial set of CMO extensions
Keywords: uniform, shall

Description: The total number of CSRs (Control and Status Registers) that can be encoded in the RISC-V ISA.
Constraints: ['Fixed at 4,096 (2^12) due to 12-bit encoding space (csr[11:0]).']
Keywords: sets aside, up to 4,096 CSRs, 4,096, CSRs, 12-bit, encoding space, sets aside, up to, 12-bit encoding space

Description: Determines the lowest privilege level that can access a CSR based on bits csr[9:8] of the CSR address.
Constraints: The top two bits indicate read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11).
Keywords: read-only, privilege level, read/write, encode, convention, by convention

Description: Convention for encoding CSR read/write accessibility and minimum privilege level in upper bits of CSR address
Constraints:
- Upper 4 bits of CSR address (csr[11:8]) used for encoding
- csr[11:10] indicate read/write (00,01,10) vs read-only (11)
- csr[9:8] encode lowest privilege level that can access CSR
Keywords: convention, by convention, according to, used to encode

Description: Width of the CSR address field in bits
Constraints: Fixed at 12 bits, allowing up to 4096 CSRs
Keywords: up to 4096 CSRs, 12-bit

Description: Maximum number of CSRs that can be addressed
Keywords: up to 4096

Description: Encoding of the upper 4 bits of the CSR address to define read/write accessibility per privilege level
Constraints: Uses bits csr[11:8]; top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate read/write or read-only access
Keywords: upper 4 bits, privilege level, read-only, read/write

Description: Bits csr[11:10] encode whether the CSR is read/write or read-only
Constraints: Uses top two bits of CSR address; values 00, 01, or 10 indicate read/write; 11 indicates read-only
Keywords: top two bits, read-only, read/write, indicate whether

Description: Bits csr[9:8] encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
Constraints: Uses next two bits after the R/W encoding; defines minimum privilege level for access
Keywords: can access the CSR, encode the lowest privilege level, next two bits

Description: Convention for encoding CSR accessibility per privilege level using address bits
Constraints: Applies "by convention"; not strictly mandated by ISA but widely adopted
Keywords: by convention, according to privilege level

Description: Controls the accessibility of CSRs based on privilege levels.
Constraints: None mentioned.
Keywords: accessibility, privilege level

Description: Defines the size of the encoding space for CSRs.
Constraints: Limited to 12 bits for up to 4,096 CSRs.
Keywords: CSRs, encoding space, 12-bit

Description: Controls whether CSR addresses with csr[11:10] encoding are interpreted as read/write or read-only access.
Constraints: The top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate whether the register is read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11).
Keywords: by convention

Description: The encoding of the CSR address space, where the upper 4 bits (csr[11:8]) indicate the read and write accessibility of the CSRs according to privilege level
Constraints: ['The RISC-V ISA sets aside a 12-bit encoding space (csr[11:0]) for up to 4,096 CSRs', 'The top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate whether the register is read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11)', 'The next two bits (csr[9:8]) encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR']
Keywords: csr[11:0], address mapping, CSRs, Conventional, R/W accessibility, csr[11:10], csr[9:8], csr[11:8]

Description: Whether the implementation follows the standard convention for encoding R/W accessibility and privilege levels within the 12-bit CSR address space.
Constraints: The upper 4 bits (csr[11:8]) are conventionally used for accessibility and privilege encoding, but the text defines this as a "convention" rather than a hard requirement for all possible custom addresses.
Keywords: By convention, Conventional

Description: The specific bit pattern in the top two bits of the CSR address used to designate a register as read-only.
Constraints: Conventionally set to 11 for read-only.
Keywords: indicate, convention

Description: The allocation and behavior of CSRs within the 12-bit encoding space that may deviate from or extend beyond the standard convention.
Constraints: Limited to a 12-bit encoding space (up to 4,096 CSRs).
Keywords: sets aside, up to

Description: The convention for using the upper 4 bits of the CSR address to encode read/write accessibility and privilege level.
Constraints: ['upper 4 bits (csr[11:8])', 'top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate read/write (00,01, or 10) or read-only (11)', 'next two bits (csr[9:8]) encode lowest privilege level']
Keywords: By convention, are used to encode

Description: The bits in the CSR address (csr[11:8]) used to encode read/write accessibility based on privilege level.
Constraints: ['Fixed at 4 bits (csr[11:8]).', 'Upper 4 bits of the 12-bit CSR address.']
Keywords: accessibility, upper 4 bits, privilege level, csr[11:8]

Description: The top two bits (csr[11:10]) of the CSR address that determine whether the CSR is read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11).
Constraints: ['Fixed at 2 bits (csr[11:10]).', {'Values': [{'00, 01, or 10': 'Read/Write.'}, {11: 'Read-Only.'}]}]
Keywords: read-only, read/write, top two bits, 00, 01, 11, 10, csr[11:10]

Description: The next two bits (csr[9:8]) of the CSR address that encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR.
Constraints: ['Fixed at 2 bits (csr[9:8]).', 'Encodes the lowest privilege level (e.g., U, S, M).']
Keywords: access, lowest privilege level, next two bits, csr[9:8]

Description: Whether the CSR accessibility follows the conventional encoding scheme (privilege-level-based R/W accessibility).
Constraints: ['By convention, the encoding follows the described scheme, but implementations may deviate.', 'No explicit requirement to follow convention; deviations are allowed.']
